I mean in some cases I mean some people

of life um you know the the Despair and

there's none of the kind of tidying up
it is it is agonizing pain and he
doesn't make any apologies for that
whatsoever and it goes over it's a poem

tolling of the Bells and each time

each time there's a different aspect of

something in that to me that captures
grief each year it is

concerned when grief becomes
pathological that there's no question

vulnerable people and there's no

that's the funeral all those things the

occupied up to a point it's those

understand up to a point but nobody can

loses that
person the memories are are ID syncratic

friends and

uh was the experience of going public
and
um an un Quiet Mind and the the public

the loss of privacy and one of the

talking about um having been psychotic

my colleagues in academic medicine was

private and I was brought up in the

those things don't make you very likely
to put your private life out there and I
was brought up in a family where you
kept you know a really warm family I
love my family deeply but you know you
sort of got a grip and you didn't talk
and my husband oddly enough who was a

and and he studied uh schizophrenia and
he treated people who had
schizophrenia and he said you know
there's an obligation to do it he and I
will back you and of course it's
personal of course it's private and of
course it's going to be excruciating for
you and you know for the first I don't
know 30 or 40 times I got up and talked

could think of was my grandmother you
know with her white gloves and her hat
and you know I would just be mortified I
was thinking what am I doing talking
about this how could I possibly talk
about having tried to kill myself how
could I do this and yet you know at the

because you you hope that it will help
it'll be one part one small piece in
making people more comfortable about it
you know people can talk about having
bre bre cancer why can't people who have
metal illness talk about mental illness

very fortunate in
having this particular person in my
life
